nodes.text: Paying a small sum of money to an official to perform their normal or routine duty or function, or to speed up their actions is known as a facilitation payment.
We never make facilitation payments and we do not allow others who work for or represent us to make them.
No matter how small the amount facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
On rare occasions you may be coerced or forced into paying. If your safety or liberty or that of a family member is threatened, then you should pay.

There are legitimate fees for speeding up some services. In such cases the fees should be fixed and published, the payment must be transparent and open, and you must obtain a receipt and record the transaction.
If you do pay you must report it.  Record the payment and the circumstances as soon as possible to your line manager and Legal department.
We are committed to free and open competition in our markets. We compete fairly and ethically, and support laws that promote and protect competition.
We will never discuss or agree to enter into any anti-competitive agreements with our competitors.  Doing so can be a criminal offence resulting in heavy penalties and prosecution.
Report any suspicion or evidence of this behaviour immediately to your legal team.
Do not continue any conversations of this nature or any other competitively sensitive information any further.  Leave the meeting or the event if it is happening.
We will never partner with the explicit goal of eliminating all competition, rigging a competitive bidding process, including arrangements to submit a sham bid
If you feel that your safety or liberty is threatened and you are being coerced into paying, then you should pay.
You must record the payment and the circumstances and report them as soon as possible to your line manager and the legal or compliance department.
Record the payment clearly and when claiming the cost back from the company, make sure it is clearly identified and accounted for
